description:
Application to vary condition 37 (deliveries and servicing hours) of planning permission ref: P2016/5040/S73 dated 14/11/2017 for:

"Variation of Condition 1 (Approved Plans), Condition 6(d) (Basement Layout), Condition 12(c) (Materials/Samples) and Condition 42 (Second Floor Open Space terrace Area) of Planning Permission Ref: P2014/0782/S73 dated 29 January 2015 that granted demolition of existing buildings and the construction of a mixed use development comprising two 21 storey buildings; 10 storey building; and 3 storey building for 355 residential dwellings (use class C3); 2172sqm (GEA) of office floor space (use class B1); 436sqm (GEA) of restaurant and caf√© floor space (use class A3); 9665sqm (GEA) of flexible floor spaces for uses within use classes A1-A4 and/or gym (use class D2) and/or including up to 2000sqm (GEA) of office floor space (B1 use class) at first floor only; together with associated disabled and car club parking spaces, cycle spaces, storage, associated access, public realm and private and public amenity space. The amendments propose to amend the external elevations with the use of precast concrete panels in place of render, alterations to the second floor podium landscaping including the erection of a plant enclosure, amendments to the tops of the two tower buildings and internal alterations at basement level". 

The proposed amendment seeks to increase the delivery and servicing hours for only one of the retail units within the development.
decision_conditions:
You are advised that any resubmission should seek to address concerns raised by the Acoustics Officer (Environmental Pollution, Policy & Projects) relating to (and not limited to):
-	The report only notes a 3dB penalty with no justification or assessment as per British Standard 4142:2014.  
-	The report should include the noise of the vehicle arriving on-site, vehicles warning alarms, tail lift noise and should refer to the potential noise generated by the trolleys/cages being moved internally around the store.  
-	The report notes 2019 background sound measurements, which are affected by construction noise and are therefore not accepted. 

It is also noted that details related to condition 22 (Delivery and Servicing Plan) have been discharged under application P2018/4253/AOD dated 14/08/2019. These approved details state the times of servicing and deliveries is restricted to 0800 to 2000 Monday to Saturday and no deliveries on a Sunday or Bank Holiday.
